title: Two Door Cinema Club - Discography (2008-2012) [FLAC]
description:
Two Door Cinema Club - Discography (2008-2012) [FLAC]

  * Genre: Pop/Rock
  * Styles: Alternative, Indie Electronic, Post-Punk, New Wave
  * Codec: FLAC
  * Bit Rates: ~ 800 - 1,000 kbps
  * Bit Depth: 16
  * Sampling Rate: 44,100 Hz

  Albums

  * 2008 Four Words to Stand On
  * 2010 Tourist History (Japan)
  * 2010 Tourist History (Deluxe 2CD)
  * 2011 Live in Sydney
  * 2012 Beacon

  Artist Bio

  * Mixing electronic polish with guitar-driven hooks ÃƒÂ  la Phoenix and the Postal Service, Bangor and Donaghadee, Northern Ireland's Two Door Cinema Club feature singer/guitarist/programmer Alex Trimble, guitarist/singer Sam Halliday, and bassist/singer Kevin Baird. Trimble and Halliday met in school, and met Baird through mutual friends. The trio began playing as Two Door Cinema Club in 2007 and skipped going to university to focus on the band. Fortunately, the gamble paid off -- the band's debut EP, Four Words to Stand On, was released in January 2009 by the hip French label KitsunÃƒÂ© to positive reviews and music blog buzz, which grew with the release of April's single "Something Good Can Work." That summer, Two Door Cinema Club recorded their debut album in London's Eastcote Studios with Eliot James, which they mixed with producer Philippe Zdar in Paris that fall. The group's remixes of Phoenix's "Lasso" and Chew Lips' "Salt Air" also appeared that year, and by 2009's end, the group was among the acts featured in the BBC Sound of 2010 Poll. Another single, "Undercover Martyn," arrived in January 2010, shortly before the band's first full-length Tourist History was released. In 2012, Two Door Cinema Club returned with its sophomore album, the Jacknife Lee-produced Beacon.
